website_summaries.verdict: These Bluetooth bulbs are a legitimate temptation for anyone interested in smart security, but consider waiting to see if new battery packs bring new features into play before buying in.
pros: BeOn's bulbs feature an intriguing mix of security-minded features not found with other smart bulbs
They'll replay your typical lighting patterns when you're away from home, turn on automatically when someone rings the doorbell and continue to work when the power goes out
A modular, upgradeable design could bring even more features down the line
cons: Basic scheduling capabilities offered by almost every other smart bulb on the market are conspicuously absent from BeOn's otherwise impressive slate of features
Also absent: integrations with third-party smart home gadgets and platforms
The bulbs are also some of the most expensive we've tested

customer_reviews.title: Two things you should know before buying
customer_reviews.text: It does everything that it says it does, but there are two things that you should be aware of before deciding to buy: The app is very slow to connect to the bulbs, it uses bluetooth to connect so you have to be very near to one of the bulbs or it won't connect at all. You have to use it in a lamp that is open top and bottom so that the bulbs can dissipate heat, otherwise the lamp will automatically turn down it's illumination to cool the lamp. This eliminates most uses in ceiling lamps unless you don't mind the auto dimming after the lamp has been on awhile.
